abstract: The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain said that Merrill Lynch International incorrectly reported details of client transactions.
snippet: The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain said that Merrill Lynch International incorrectly reported details of client transactions.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — A British regulator on Wednesday fined an arm of Bank of America Merrill Lynch 13.3 million pounds, or about $19.8 million, for failing to properly report tens of millions of client transactions over a seven-year period.

headline.main: British Regulator Fines Merrill Lynch $19.8 Million for Reporting Failures
